"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There are only 4 possibilities left to check."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1!+1!+1!=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" which is not a factorial."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note: this is pretty much identical to Sharky's solution but I tried to express it more naturally. The "without loss of generality" statement and the ordering of the variables are extremely useful and common tricks that reduce the complexity of the problem. They also make it easy to express the next idea that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"d!"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can't be more than 3 times the largest term of the left hand side. "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"9 = 3 x 3"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10 = 2 x 5"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"5^n > 10^28"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(log both the sides)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= log (5^n) > log (10^28)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= n (log 5) > 28"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= n > 28 / (log 5)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= n > 40.0589..."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, n = 41 is the minimum"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

&=\bigg[(\sqrt{x+2}-\sqrt{x+1})+(\sqrt{y+5}-\sqrt{y+1})+(\sqrt{z+10}-\sqrt{z+1})\bigg]\bigg[\dfrac{1}{\sqrt{x+2}-\sqrt{x+1}}+\dfrac4{\sqrt{y+5}-\sqrt{y+1}}+\dfrac9{\sqrt{z+10}-\sqrt{z+1}}\bigg]\\&\geq (1+2+3)^2\\&=36\end{aligned}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"At minimum this must be 0, so "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{S}{\sqrt{x+2}} = \frac{T}{\sqrt{x+1}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{S^2}{T^2} = \frac{x+2}{x+1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{S^2}{T^2} -1 = \frac{1}{x+1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" 
Doing this for y and z as well we get 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{S^2}{T^2} -1 = \frac{1}{x+1} = \frac{4}{y+1} = \frac{9}{z+1}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
Introducing a constant k such that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\frac{1}{k}=\frac{S^2}{T^2} -1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and using the original definition "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T=\sqrt{1+x}+\sqrt{1+y}+\sqrt{1+z}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", we can express T at minimum in terms of k:
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T=\sqrt{k}+\sqrt{4k}+\sqrt{9k}=6\sqrt{k}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":"
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"T^2=36k"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"And using the definition for k, we find
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S^2=(\frac{1}{k}+1)T^2=36+36k"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" 
In the difference k does not appear, so we have our answer:"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S^2-T^2=36"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Recall that by QM-AM inequality, for any positive "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a,b "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" , "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \sqrt{\frac{a^2+b^2}{2}} \geq \frac{a+b}{2} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":" with equality if and only if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" a=b "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" ."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\begin{aligned}
\text{let  } \sqrt{x+1} &= a , \sqrt{x+2} = \sqrt{a^2+1} , a>1 \\
\sqrt{y+1} &= b , \sqrt{y+5} = \sqrt{b^2+4} , b>1 \\
\sqrt{z+1} &= c , \sqrt{z+10} = \sqrt{c^2+9}, c>1 \\
\\
S &= \sqrt{a^2+1}+\sqrt{b^2+4}+\sqrt{c^2+9} \\
T &= a+b+c \\
\\
S^2-T^2 &= (\sqrt{a^2+1}+\sqrt{b^2+4}+\sqrt{c^2+9})^2 - T^2 \\
&= 2 \left( \sqrt{\frac{a^2+1^2}{2}}+\sqrt{\frac{b^2+4}{2}}+\sqrt{\frac{c^2+9}{2}} \right)^2 - T^2 \\
&\geq 2 \left( \frac{a+1}{2}+\frac{b+2}{2}+\frac{c+3}{2} \right)^2 - T^2 \\
&= \frac{(a+b+c+6)^2}{2} - (a+b+c)^2
\end{aligned}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"with equality if and only if "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=1, b=2, c=3"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" , "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\min(S^2-T^2) = \frac{(1+2+3+6)^2}{2} - (1+2+3)^2 = 36"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"note: there is a minor problem , to reach this minimum value, it must be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a=1, x=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" but "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x>0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". so this minimum value is unreachable."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"edit: "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(x,y,z)=(1,7,17)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" would make it to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"36"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". (thanks to Michael Mendrin)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
